name: recorded-future
label: Recorded Future
description: Recorded Future is a threat intelligence product that automatically collects and analyzes threat intelligence from technical, open, and dark web sources to provide invaluable context for faster human analysis and real-time integration with your existing security systems.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: URL of the Recorded Future server from where the connector gets notifications
fields.name: base_url

fields.title: API Key
fields.description: API Key that is configured for you to authenticate your Recorded Future account
fields.name: api_key

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Get Domain Reputation
operations.description: Looks up the intel threat context for a domain and retrieves its reputation from Recorded future, based on the domain name you have specified

parameters.title: Domain
parameters.description: Name of the domain for which you want to retrieve reputation from Recorded Future.
parameters.name: domain

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Fields that you want to include in the output. You can choose from the following options: Analysis Notes, Entity, Counts, Intel Card URL, Metrics, Related Entities, Risk, Sightings, Threat Lists, and Event Timestamps. By default, this option is set as Entity.
parameters.name: fields
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements. By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.name: metadata

operations.title: Get Domain Risk List
operations.description: Retrieves the risk list information for the domain(s) from Recorded Future, based on the risk rule list you have specified

parameters.title: Risk Rule List
parameters.tooltip: Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for domain (s) from Recorded Future.
parameters.description:
Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for domain (s) from Recorded Future.
You can choose from the following options: Historically Reported by Insikt Group, C&C Nameserver, C&C DNS Name, C&C URL, Compromised URL, Recently Resolved to Host of Many DDNS Names, Historically Reported as a Defanged DNS Names, Recent Fast Flux DNS Name, Historically Reported in Threat List, Historically Linked to Cyber Attack, Historical Malware Analysis DNS Name, Blacklisted DNS Name, Active Phishing URL, Ransomware Distribution URL, Ransomware Payment DNS Name, Recently Reported by Insikt Group, Recently Reported as a Defanged DNS Names, Recently Linked to Cyber Attack, Recent Malware Analysis DNS Name, Recent Threat Researcher, Recent Typosquat Similarity - DNS Sandwich, Recent Typosquat Similarity - Typo or Homograph, Recently Resolved to Malicious IP, Recently Resolved to Suspicious IP, Recently Resolved to Unusual IP, Recently Resolved to Very Malicious IP, Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community, Historical Threat Researcher, Historical Typosquat Similarity - DNS Sandwich, or Historical Typosquat Similarity - Typo or Homograph.
parameters.name: risk_rule_list
options: Recently Resolved to Host of Many DDNS Names
Historically Reported as a Defanged DNS Names
Recently Reported as a Defanged DNS Names
Recent Typosquat Similarity - Typo or Homograph
Recently Resolved to Very Malicious IP
Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community
Historical Typosquat Similarity - Typo or Homograph

operations.title: Search Domain
operations.description: Searches for and retrieves information about intel threat context for all domains or specific domain(s) (based on the filter criteria you have specified) from Recorded Future

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: Fields that you want to include in the output. You can choose from the following options: Analysis Notes, Entity, Counts, Intel Card URL, Metrics, Related Entities, Risk, Sightings, Threat Lists, and Event Timestamps. By default, this option is set as Entity.
parameters.name: fields
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements. By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 10.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of records

parameters.title: From
parameters.description: Index of the first item to return from the search result.
parameters.tooltip: Records from offset
parameters.name: from

parameters.title: Risk Score
parameters.description:
Filter the search results by the risk score, which are integer values from 0 to 100.For example, Risk Score=[20,90] // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=(20,90) // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=[20,90) // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=[20,) // same as 20 <= Risk Score
Risk Score=[,90) // same as Risk Score < 90
parameters.tooltip: Eg. [20,90] same as 20 <= riskScore <= 90, [20,90) same as 20 <= riskScore < 90
parameters.name: riskScore

parameters.title: First Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the first see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid). For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: First seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: firstSeen

parameters.title: Last Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the last see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid).For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: Last seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: lastSeen

parameters.title: List ID
parameters.description: Vulnerability ID from Recorded Future. For example, idn:ddobnajanu.club
parameters.tooltip: Vulnerability ID from Recorded Future Eg. idn:ddobnajanu.club
parameters.name: list

parameters.title: Risk Rule
parameters.description:
Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for domain (s) from Recorded Future.
You can choose from the following options: Historically Reported by Insikt Group, C&C Nameserver, C&C DNS Name, C&C URL, Compromised URL, Recently Resolved to Host of Many DDNS Names, Historically Reported as a Defanged DNS Names, Recent Fast Flux DNS Name, Historically Reported in Threat List, Large, Historically Linked to Cyber Attack, Historical Malware Analysis DNS Name, Blacklisted DNS Name, Active Phishing URL, Ransomware Distribution URL, Ransomware Payment DNS Name, Recently Reported by Insikt Group, Recently Reported as a Defanged DNS Names, Recently Linked to Cyber Attack, Recent Malware Analysis DNS Name, Recent Threat Researcher, Recent Typosquat Similarity - DNS Sandwich, Recent Typosquat Similarity - Typo or Homograph, Recently Resolved to Malicious IP, Recently Resolved to Suspicious IP, Recently Resolved to Unusual IP, Recently Resolved to Very Malicious IP, Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community, Historical Threat Researcher, Historical Typosquat Similarity - DNS Sandwich, or Historical Typosquat Similarity - Typo or Homograph.
parameters.name: riskRule
options: Recently Resolved to Host of Many DDNS Names
Historically Reported as a Defanged DNS Names
Recently Reported as a Defanged DNS Names
Recent Typosquat Similarity - Typo or Homograph
Recently Resolved to Very Malicious IP
Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community
Historical Typosquat Similarity - Typo or Homograph

parameters.title: Parent
parameters.description: Filter domains (including FQDNs) in a parent domain or a subdomain.
parameters.tooltip: Subdomains with parent
parameters.name: parent

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.description: Order the search results by this filter criteria. You can choose from the following options: Created, Criticality, First Seen, Last Seen, Modified, Risk Score, Rules, Seven Days Hits, Sixty Days Hits, or Total Hits.
parameters.name: orderby

parameters.title: Direction
parameters.description: Arrange the search results either in the Ascending order or Descending order based on the risk score.
parameters.name: direction

operations.title: Get IP Reputation
operations.description: Looks up the intel threat context for an IP address and retrieves its reputation from Recorded Future, based on the IP address you have specified

parameters.title: IP Address
parameters.description: IP address for which you want to retrieve reputation from Recorded Future.
parameters.name: ip

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Fields that you want to include in the output. You can choose from the following options: Analysis Notes, Entity, Counts, Intel Card URL, Metrics, Related Entities, Risk, Sightings, Threat Lists, and Event Timestamps. By default, this option is set as Entity.
parameters.name: fields
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements. By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.name: metadata

operations.title: Get IP Risk List
operations.description: Retrieves the risk list information for the IP address(es) from Recorded Future, based on the risk rule list you have specified

parameters.title: Risk Rule List
parameters.description:
Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for IP address(es) from Recorded Future.
You can choose from the following options: Historically Reported by Insikt Group, Inside Possible Bogus BGP Route, Historical Botnet Traffic, Nameserver for C&C Server, Historical C&C Server, Cyber Exploit Signal: Important, Cyber Exploit Signal: Medium, Recent Host of Many DDNS Names, Historically Reported as a Defanged IP, Resolution of Fast Flux DNS Name, Historically Reported in Threat List, Historical Honeypot Sighting, Honeypot Host, Recent C&C Server, Historically Linked to Intrusion Method, Historically Linked to APT, Historically Linked to Cyber Attack, Malicious Packet Source, Malware Delivery, Historical Multicategory Blacklist, Historical Open Proxies, Phishing Host, Historical Positive Malware Verdict, Recently Reported by Insikt Group, Recent Botnet Traffic, Current C&C Server, Recently Reported as Defanged IP, Recent Honeypot Sighting, Recently Linked to Intrusion Method, Recently Linked to APT, Recently Linked to Cyber Attack, Recent Multicategory Blacklist, Recent Open Proxies, Recent Positive Malware Verdict, Recent Spam Source, Recent SSH/Dictionary Attacker, Recent Bad SSL Association, Recent Threat Researcher, Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community, Historical Spam Source, Historical SSH/Dictionary Attacker, Historical Bad SSL Association, Historical Threat Researcher, Tor Node, Unusual IP, or Vulnerable Host.
parameters.name: risk_rule_list
options: Recent Host of Many DDNS Names
Historically Reported as a Defanged IP
Resolution of Fast Flux DNS Name
Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community

operations.title: Search IP
operations.description: Searches for and retrieves information about intel threat context for all IP addresses or specific IP address(es) (based on the filter criteria you have specified) from Recorded Future

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: Fields that you want to include in the output. You can choose from the following options: Analysis Notes, Entity, Counts, Intel Card URL, Metrics, Related Entities, Risk, Sightings, Threat Lists, and Event Timestamps. By default, this option is set as Entity.
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output
parameters.name: fields

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements. By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 10.
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of records
parameters.name: limit

parameters.title: From
parameters.description: Records from offset.
parameters.tooltip: Records from offset
parameters.name: from

parameters.title: Range
parameters.description: Range of IP addresses from starting IP address to ending IP address or CIDR.For example, 1.2.3.4/24 or 1.2.3.4-5.6.7.8.
parameters.tooltip: Range as start-end or CIDR eg.format 1.2.3.4/24 or 1.2.3.4-5.6.7.8
parameters.name: range

parameters.title: Risk Score
parameters.description:
Filter the search results by the risk score, which are integer values from 0 to 100.
For example, Risk Score=[20,90] // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=(20,90) // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=[20,90) // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=[20,) // same as 20 <= Risk Score
Risk Score=[,90) // same as Risk Score < 90
parameters.tooltip: Eg. [20,90] same as 20 <= riskScore <= 90, [20,90) same as 20 <= riskScore < 90
parameters.name: riskScore

parameters.title: First Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the first see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid).For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: First seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: firstSeen

parameters.title: Last Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the last see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid).For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: Last seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: lastSeen

parameters.title: List ID
parameters.description: Vulnerability ID from Recorded Future.For example, ip:199.173.128.0/20
parameters.tooltip: Vulnerability ID from Recorded Future Eg. ip:199.173.128.0/20
parameters.name: list

parameters.title: Risk Rule
parameters.description:
Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for IP address(es) from Recorded Future.
You can choose from the following options: Historically Reported by Insikt Group, Inside Possible Bogus BGP Route, Historical Botnet Traffic, Nameserver for C&C Server, Historical C&C Server, Cyber Exploit Signal: Important, Cyber Exploit Signal: Medium, Recent Host of Many DDNS Names, Historically Reported as a Defanged IP, Resolution of Fast Flux DNS Name, Historically Reported in Threat List, Historical Honeypot Sighting, Honeypot Host, Recent C&C Server, Large, Historically Linked to Intrusion Method, Historically Linked to APT, Historically Linked to Cyber Attack, Malicious Packet Source, Malware Delivery, Historical Multicategory Blacklist, Historical Open Proxies, Phishing Host, Historical Positive Malware Verdict, Recently Reported by Insikt Group, Recent Botnet Traffic, Current C&C Server, Recently Reported as Defanged IP, Recent Honeypot Sighting, Recently Linked to Intrusion Method, Recently Linked to APT, Recently Linked to Cyber Attack, Recent Multicategory Blacklist, Recent Open Proxies, Recent Positive Malware Verdict, Recent Spam Source, Recent SSH/Dictionary Attacker, Recent Bad SSL Association, Recent Threat Researcher, Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community, Historical Spam Source, Historical SSH/Dictionary Attacker, Historical Bad SSL Association, Historical Threat Researcher, Tor Node, Unusual IP, or Vulnerable Host.
parameters.name: riskRule
options: Recent Host of Many DDNS Names
Historically Reported as a Defanged IP
Resolution of Fast Flux DNS Name
Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.description: Order the search results by this filter criteria. You can choose from the following options: Created, Criticality, First Seen, Last Seen, Modified, Risk Score, Rules, Seven Days Hits, Sixty Days Hits, or Total Hits.
parameters.name: orderby

parameters.title: Direction
parameters.description: Arrange the search results either in the Ascending order or Descending order based on the risk score.
parameters.name: direction

operations.title: Get File Reputation
operations.description: Looks up the intel threat context for a file identity hash (MD5, SHA-1 or SHA-256) and retrieves its reputation from Recorded future, based on the file hash you have specified

parameters.title: Filehash
parameters.description: Filehash (MD5, SHA-1 or SHA-256) whose reputation you want to retrieve from Recorded Future.
parameters.name: hash

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Fields that you want to include in the output. You can choose from the following options: Analysis Notes, Entity, Counts, Intel Card URL, Metrics, Related Entities, Risk, Sightings, Threat Lists, and Event Timestamps. By default, this option is set as Entity.
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output
parameters.name: fields

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements.By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.name: metadata

operations.title: Get File Risk List
operations.description: Retrieves the risk list information for the file(s) from Recorded Future, based on the risk rule list you have specified

parameters.title: Risk Rule List
parameters.description:
Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for file(s) from Recorded Future.
You can choose from the following options: Reported by Insikt Group, Historically Reported in Threat List, Linked to Cyber Attack, Linked to Malware, Linked to Attack Vector, Linked to Vulnerability, Malware SSL Certificate Fingerprint, Positive Malware Verdict, Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community, or Threat Researcher.
parameters.name: risk_rule_list
options: Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community

operations.title: Search Filehash
operations.description: Searches for and retrieves information about intel threat context for all filehashes or specific filehash(es) (based on the filter criteria you have specified) from Recorded Future

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: Fields that you want to include in the output. You can choose from the following options: Analysis Notes, Entity, Counts, Intel Card URL, Metrics, Related Entities, Risk, Sightings, Threat Lists, and Event Timestamps. By default, this option is set as Entity.
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output
parameters.name: fields

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements. By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 10.
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of records
parameters.name: limit

parameters.title: From
parameters.description: Records from offset.
parameters.tooltip: Records from offset
parameters.name: from

parameters.title: Risk Score
parameters.description:
Filter the search results by the risk score, which are integer values from 0 to 100.
For example, Risk Score=[20,90] // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=(20,90) // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=[20,90) // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=[20,) // same as 20 <= Risk Score
Risk Score=[,90) // same as Risk Score < 90
parameters.tooltip: Eg. [20,90] same as 20 <= riskScore <= 90, [20,90) same as 20 <= riskScore < 90
parameters.name: riskScore

parameters.title: Algorithm
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the hash algorithm. You can choose from the following options: CRC-32, CTPH, MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, or SHA-512.
parameters.tooltip: Hash algorithm
parameters.name: algorithm

parameters.title: First Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the first see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid).For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: First seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: firstSeen

parameters.title: Last Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the last see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid). For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: Last seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: lastSeen

parameters.title: List ID
parameters.description: Vulnerability ID from Recorded Future.For example, hash:1d724f95c61f1055f0d02c2154bbccd3
parameters.tooltip: Vulnerability ID from Recorded Future Eg. hash:1d724f95c61f1055f0d02c2154bbccd3
parameters.name: list

parameters.title: Risk Rule
parameters.description:
Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for filehash(es) from Recorded Future.
You can choose from the following options: Reported by Insikt Group, Historically Reported in Threat List, Linked to Cyber Attack, Linked to Malware, Linked to Attack Vector, Linked to Vulnerability, Malware SSL Certificate Fingerprint, Positive Malware Verdict, Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community, or Threat Researcher.
parameters.name: riskRule
options: Trending in Recorded Future Analyst Community

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.description: Order the search results by this filter criteria. You can choose from the following options: Created, Criticality, First Seen, Last Seen, Modified, Risk Score, Rules, Seven Days Hits, Sixty Days Hits, or Total Hits.
parameters.name: orderby

parameters.title: Direction
parameters.description: Arrange the search results either in the Ascending order or Descending order based on the risk score.
parameters.name: direction

operations.title: Lookup Vulnerability
operations.description: Looks up the intel threat context for a vulnerability and retrieves its information from Recorded future, based on the CVE Identifier ID or Recorded Future ID you have specified

parameters.title: CVE/RF ID
parameters.description: CVE Identifier ID or Recorded Future ID whose reputation you want to retrieve from Recorded Future. For example CVE IDs: CVE-2018-8811, CVE-2018-8810. RF ID = Vga53v
parameters.name: cve_id

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description:
(Optional) Fields that you want to include in the output.
You can choose from the following options: National Vulnerability Database description, Analyst Notes, Common Names, Entity, Counts, Common Platform Enumeration, Common Platform Enumeration 2.2 URI, Common Vulnerability Scoring System, Intel Card URL, Metrics, Related Entities, Related Links, Risk, Sightings, Threat Lists, or Event Timestamps.
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output
parameters.name: fields

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements. By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.name: metadata

operations.title: Get vulnerability Risk List
operations.description: Retrieves the risk list information for the vulnerability(ies) from Recorded Future, based on the risk rule list you have specified

parameters.title: Risk Rule List
parameters.description:
Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for vulnerability(ies) from Recorded Future.
You can choose from the following options: Historically Reported by Insikt Group, Web Reporting Prior to CVSS Score, Cyber Exploit Signal: Critical, Cyber Exploit Signal: Important, Cyber Exploit Signal: Medium, Linked to Historical Cyber Exploit, Historically Linked to Exploit Kit, Historically Linked to Malware, Historically Linked to Remote Access Trojan, Historically Linked to Ransomware, Linked to Recent Cyber Exploit, Recently Linked to Exploit Kit, Recently Linked to Malware, Recently Linked to Remote Access Trojan, Recently Linked to Ransomware, NIST Severity: Critical, NIST Severity: High, NIST Severity: Low, NIST Severity: Medium, Web Reporting Prior to NVD Disclosure, Recently Reported by Insikt Group, Recently Linked to Penetration Testing Tools, or Historically Linked to Penetration Testing Tools.
parameters.name: risk_rule_list
options: Web Reporting Prior to CVSS Score
Historically Linked to Remote Access Trojan
Recently Linked to Remote Access Trojan
Web Reporting Prior to NVD Disclosure
Recently Linked to Penetration Testing Tools
Historically Linked to Penetration Testing Tools

operations.title: Search Vulnerabilities
operations.description: Searches for and retrieves information about intel threat context for all vulnerabilities or specific vulnerabilities(ies) (based on the filter criteria you have specified) from Recorded Futures

parameters.title: Free Text
parameters.description: Free text (not regex) string matching which list IDs are returned as the search result.
parameters.tooltip: Free text search
parameters.name: freetext

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description:
Fields that you want to include in the output.
You can choose from the following options: National Vulnerability Database description, Analyst Notes, Common Names, Entity, Counts, Common Platform Enumeration, Common Platform Enumeration 2.2 URI, Common Vulnerability Scoring System, Intel Card URL, Metrics, Related Entities, Related Links, Risk, Sightings, Threat Lists, or Event Timestamps.
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output
parameters.name: fields

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements.By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 10.
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of records
parameters.name: limit

parameters.title: From
parameters.description: Records from offset.
parameters.tooltip: Records from offset
parameters.name: from

parameters.title: Risk Score
parameters.description:
Filter the search results by the risk score, which are integer values from 0 to 100.
For example, Risk Score=[20,90] // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=(20,90) // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=[20,90) // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=[20,) // same as 20 <= Risk Score
Risk Score=[,90) // same as Risk Score < 90
parameters.tooltip: Eg. [20,90] same as 20 <= riskScore <= 90, [20,90) same as 20 <= riskScore < 90
parameters.name: riskScore

parameters.title: CVSS Score
parameters.description:
Filter the search results by the common vulnerability scoring system score (CVSS score). You can enter a number between 0 to 10 as the CVSS score in the format [0,10]
For example, [2,9.3], (2,9.3), [2,3.6), (6,), (,8) . Working of the CVSS score examples is the same as the risk score examples.
parameters.tooltip: Common Vulnerability Scoring System Score between 0 to 10 Eg. [2,9] same as 2 <= CVSS Score <= 9, [2,9) same as 2 <= CVSS Score < 9
parameters.name: cvssScore

parameters.title: First Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the first see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid). For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: First seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: firstSeen

parameters.title: Last Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the last see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid).For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: Last seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: lastSeen

parameters.title: List ID
parameters.description: Vulnerability ID from Recorded Future.For example, PGW3XH
parameters.tooltip: Vulnerability ID from Recorded Future Eg. PGW3XH
parameters.name: list

parameters.title: Risk Rule
parameters.description:
Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for vulnerability(ies) from Recorded Future.
You can choose from the following options: Historically Reported by Insikt Group, Web Reporting Prior to CVSS Score, Cyber Exploit Signal: Critical, Cyber Exploit Signal: Important, Cyber Exploit Signal: Medium, Large, Linked to Historical Cyber Exploit, Historically Linked to Exploit Kit, Historically Linked to Malware, Historically Linked to Remote Access Trojan, Historically Linked to Ransomware, Linked to Recent Cyber Exploit, Recently Linked to Exploit Kit, Recently Linked to Malware, Recently Linked to Remote Access Trojan, Recently Linked to Ransomware, NIST Severity: Critical, NIST Severity: High, NIST Severity: Low, NIST Severity: Medium, Web Reporting Prior to NVD Disclosure, Recently Reported by Insikt Group, Recently Linked to Penetration Testing Tools, or Historically Linked to Penetration Testing Tools.
parameters.name: riskRule
options: Web Reporting Prior to CVSS Score
Historically Linked to Remote Access Trojan
Recently Linked to Remote Access Trojan
Web Reporting Prior to NVD Disclosure

Historically Linked to Penetration Testing Tools

parameters.description: Order the search results by this filter criteria. You can choose from the following options: Created, Criticality, First Seen, Last Seen, Modified, Risk Score, Rules, Seven Days Hits, Sixty Days Hits, or Total Hits.
parameters.name: orderby

parameters.description: Arrange the search results either in the Ascending order or Descending order based on the risk score.

parameters.title: Fields

parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output
parameters.name: fields

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get URL Risk List

parameters.title: Risk Rule List
parameters.description: Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for URL(s) from Recorded Future. You can choose from the following options: C&C URL, Compromised URL, Historically Reported as a Defanged URL, Historically Reported in Threat List, Large, Active Phishing URL, Ransomware Distribution URL, or Recently Reported as e Defanged URL.

Recently Reported as e Defanged URL

operations.title: Search URL
operations.description: Searches for and retrieves information about intel threat context for all URLs or specific URL(s) (based on the filter criteria you have specified) from Recorded Future

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: Fields that you want to include in the output. You can choose from the following options: Analyst Notes, Entity, Counts, Metrics, Related Entities, Risk, Sightings, or Event Timestamps.
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output
parameters.name: fields

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements.By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 10.
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of records
parameters.name: limit

parameters.title: From
parameters.description: Records from offset.
parameters.tooltip: Records from offset
parameters.name: from

parameters.title: Risk Score
parameters.description:
Filter the search results by the risk score, which are integer values from 0 to 100.
For example, Risk Score=[20,90] // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=(20,90) // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=[20,90) // same as 20 <= Risk Score <= 90
Risk Score=[20,) // same as 20 <= Risk Score
Risk Score=[,90) // same as Risk Score < 90
parameters.tooltip: Eg. [20,90] same as 20 <= riskScore <= 90, [20,90) same as 20 <= riskScore < 90
parameters.name: riskScore

parameters.title: First Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the first see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid). For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: First seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: firstSeen

parameters.title: Last Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the last see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid). For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: Last seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: lastSeen

parameters.title: List ID
parameters.description: Vulnerability ID from Recorded Future. For example, url:http://examplendv.com/niugufvt4
parameters.tooltip: Vulnerability ID Eg. url:http://example.com
parameters.name: list

parameters.title: Risk Rule
parameters.description: Risk Rule List based on which you want to retrieve risk list information for URL(s) from Recorded Future. You can choose from the following options: C&C URL, Compromised URL, Historically Reported as a Defanged URL, Historically Reported in Threat List, Active Phishing URL, Ransomware Distribution URL, or Recently Reported as e Defanged URL.
parameters.name: riskRule
options: Historically Reported as a Defanged URL
Recently Reported as e Defanged URL

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.description:
Order the search results by this filter criteria.
You can choose from the following options: Created, Criticality, First Seen, Last Seen, Modified, Risk Score, Rules, Seven Days Hits, Sixty Days Hits, or Total Hits.
parameters.name: orderby

parameters.title: Direction
parameters.description: Arrange the search results either in the Ascending order or Descending order based on the risk score.
parameters.name: direction

operations.title: Lookup Malware
operations.description: Looks up the intel threat context for a Malware and retrieves its information from Recorded future, based on the Malware ID you have specified

parameters.title: ID
parameters.description: ID of the Malware for which you want to retrieve threat information from Recorded Future.
parameters.tooltip: Malware ID
parameters.name: malware_id

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Fields that you want to include in the output. You can choose from the following options: Analyst Notes, Entity, Counts, Metrics, Intel Card URL, Related Entities, Sightings, Categories, or Event Timestamps.
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output
parameters.name: fields

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements. By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.tooltip: Include Metadata
parameters.name: metadata

operations.title: Search Malware
operations.description: Searches for and retrieves information about intel threat context for all Malwares or specific Malware(s) (based on the filter criteria you have specified) from Recorded Future

parameters.title: Free Text
parameters.description: Free text (not regex) string matching which list IDs are returned as the search result.
parameters.tooltip: Free text search
parameters.name: freetext

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: Fields that you want to include in the output. You can choose from the following options: Analyst Notes, Entity, Counts, Metrics, Intel Card URL, Related Entities, Sightings, Categories, or Event Timestamps.
parameters.tooltip: Fields to include in output
parameters.name: fields

parameters.title: Metadata
parameters.description: Select this option to annotate the response with additional metadata explaining the response data elements.By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 10.
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of records
parameters.name: limit

parameters.title: From
parameters.description: Records from offset.
parameters.tooltip: Records from offset
parameters.name: from

parameters.title: First Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the first see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid). For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: First seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: firstSeen

parameters.title: Last Seen
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the last see date (all ElasticSearch compatible date formats are valid).For example, 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01, 2017/01/01
parameters.tooltip: Last seen date, all Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid Eg. 2017-03-14T18:01:18.750Z, 2017-01-01
parameters.name: lastSeen

parameters.title: List ID
parameters.description: Vulnerability ID from Recorded Future. For example, Ps4Y1A
parameters.tooltip: Vulnerability ID Eg. Ps4Y1A
parameters.name: list

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.description: Order the search results by this filter criteria. You can choose from the following options: Created, Criticality, First Seen, Last Seen, Modified, Risk Score, Rules, Seven Days Hits, Sixty Days Hits, or Total Hits.
parameters.name: orderby

parameters.title: Direction
parameters.description: Arrange the search results either in the Ascending order or Descending order based on metrics (counts of recent references and metric values for various risk rules).
parameters.name: direction

operations.title: Get Alert
operations.description: Retrieves details for an alert which is generated in Recorded Future, based on the alert ID you have specified

parameters.title: Alert ID
parameters.description: ID of the alert generated on Recorded Future for which you want to retrieve information from Recorded Future.
parameters.name: alert_ID

operations.title: Search Alerts
operations.description: Searches for and retrieves notification information for all alerts or specific alert(s) (based on the filter criteria you have specified) generated on Recorded Future

parameters.title: Triggered
parameters.description: DateTime when the alert was generated on Recorded Future. All Elasticsearch compatible date formats are valid. Relative time expressions are also supported, such as -2d for two days prior to today and yesterday. As with absolute time references, both ends of the range still need to be specified. For example, to search for alerts that fired within the last 24 hrs, use triggered = [-24h,].
parameters.tooltip: This is datetime when the alert was generated
parameters.name: triggered

parameters.title: Assignee
parameters.description: Filter the search results by the name of the assignee to whom the alert was assigned in Recorded Future, using the email address associated with that user account.
parameters.name: assignee

parameters.title: Status
parameters.description: Status of the alert. You can choose from the following options: Unassigned, Assigned, Actionable, No Action, or Tuning.
parameters.name: status

parameters.title: Alert Rule ID
parameters.description: Recorded Future's Alert Rule ID that is associated with the alert notification.
parameters.tooltip: Recorded Future alert ID associated with the alert instance
parameters.name: alertRule

parameters.title: Free Text
parameters.description: Free text (not regex) string matching which list IDs are returned as the search result.
parameters.name: freetext

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results that this operation should return.By default, this option is set as 10.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.title: From
parameters.description: Records from offset.
parameters.tooltip: Records from offset
parameters.name: from

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.description: Order the search results by this filter criteria. Currently, only the Triggered option is available.
parameters.name: orderby

parameters.title: Direction
parameters.description: Arrange the search results either in the Ascending order or Descending order.
parameters.name: direction

operations.title: Search Alert Rules

parameters.name: freetext

parameters.description: Maximum number of results that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 10.
parameters.name: limit
